metadata.title: PHP
metadata.intro: This [PHP](https://www.php.net/manual/en/) cheat sheet provides a reference for quickly looking up the correct syntax for the code you use most frequently.

cards.title: hello.php
cards.footer:
PHP run command
```shell script
$ php hello.php
```

cards.title: Variables
Strings
Arrays
cards.body:
```php
$num = [1, 3, 5, 7, 9];
$num[5] = 11;
unset($num[2]);    // Delete variable
print_r($num);     # => 1 3 7 9 11
echo count($num);  # => 5
```

Manipulation
cards.body:
```php
$s = "Hello Phper";
echo strlen($s);       # => 11

echo substr($s, 0, 3); # => Hel
echo substr($s, 1);    # => ello Phper
echo substr($s, -4, 3);# => hpe

echo strtoupper($s);   # => HELLO PHPER
echo strtolower($s);   # => hello phper

echo strpos($s, "l");      # => 2
var_dump(strpos($s, "L")); # => false
```

cards.title: Defining
cards.footer:
#### Mixed int and string keys

```php
$array = array(
    "foo" => "bar",
    "bar" => "foo",
    100   => -100,
    -100  => 100,
);
var_dump($array);
```

#### Short array syntax

```php
$array = [
    "foo" => "bar",
    "bar" => "foo",
];
```

cards.title: Multi array
cards.body:
```php
$multiArray = [
    [1, 2, 3],
    [4, 5, 6],
    [7, 8, 9],
];

print_r($multiArray[0][0]) # => 1
print_r($multiArray[0][1]) # => 2
print_r($multiArray[0][2]) # => 3
```

cards.title: Multi type
manipulation
cards.body:
```php
$arr = array(5 => 1, 12 => 2);
$arr[] = 56;      // Append
$arr["x"] = 42;   // Add with key
sort($arr);       // Sort
unset($arr[5]);   // Remove
unset($arr);      // Remove all
```

cards.title: Super Global Variables
cards.body:
| Variable     | Description                                                  |
|--------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------|
| `$_SERVER`   | Holds information about headers, paths, and script locations |
| `$_GET`      | Contains data sent via URL parameters (query string)         |
| `$_POST`     | Contains data sent via HTTP POST method                      |
| `$_FILES`    | Contains information about uploaded files                    |
| `$_COOKIE`   | Contains cookie data                                         |
| `$_SESSION`  | Stores session variables                                     |
| `$_REQUEST`  | Contains data from `$_GET`, `$_POST`, and `$_COOKIE`         |
| `$_ENV`      | Contains environment variables                               |
| `$GLOBALS`   | References all global variables available in the script      |

{.left-text}

Super Global Variables are built-in variables always available in all scopes.
